column1: In Edirisuriya v Navarathnam and others [1985] 1 SLR 100 which was a Fundamental
Rights  Application,  the  Court  held  that  under  Article  126(2)  of  the  Constitution,  the
time limit given for Fundamental Right Applications to be filed is of mandatory nature.
In the said Article, again it demonstrates that an application has to be made within one
month thereof in accordance “with such rules of Court as may be in force” and also the
Article  provides  that  an  application  of  such  nature  may  proceed  with  only  leave  to
proceed first had and obtained from the Supreme Court. In the said case, the Court held
that the time limit contemplated thereon is of mandatory nature.
